about
Jamie Starr's sophmore release The Holy Mountain is a musical journey start to finish crossing gengres and sonic boundaries at the same time. This time around taking on more of the writting on the album, he did take advantage of the new talent under the growing Echoscape roster. He is joined by Bonnie, D.Johns, Pete Kennedy Comfort In Noise, Cowslanlr, and frequent collaborator Cans. While being executive produced by Jamie Starr, both Cans and Dustin Terry also oversaw the project from its inception. Originally going to be called The Butterfly Effect it was renamed after being presented with different artwork by Corey Fillion. Along with drawing inspiration from the Alejandro Jodorowsky film, of the same name ( The Holy Mountain )
credits
released 21 December 2012
Instruments. Production, Vox & Lyrics - James Scutt ( Jamie Starr ) 
Additional Lyrics & Vocals by Pete Kennedy otherwise noted
